an10.113:4.1: “Mendicants, you should know bad principles with bad results.
an10.113:4.2: And you should know good principles with good results.
an10.113:4.3: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.
an10.113:5.1: And what are bad principles with bad results?
an10.113:5.2: Wrong view, wrong motivation, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong mindfulness, wrong samādhi, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.
an10.113:5.3: These are called bad principles with bad results.
an10.113:6.1: And what are good principles with good results?
an10.113:6.2: Right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right mindfulness, right samādhi, right knowledge, and right freedom.
an10.113:6.3: These are called good principles with good results.
an10.113:7.1: ‘You should know bad principles with bad results.
an10.113:7.2: And you should know good principles with good results.
an10.113:7.3: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.’ That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.”
